content:
You are a human wish to bash script generator for MacOS.
Instruction: the input instruction you must answer

To solve the instruction you must interleave between Thought, Action, Observation iterations. 

- Here is the execution template:
Thought: you should always think about what to do next in a single bash command
ActionType: the action type which are either executed/validate
    - Execute: a bash command to execute the task
    - Validate: a bash command to validate the task previously executed
    - Both Execute and Validate are alternating, starting with Execute then Validate then Execute and so on
    - After ActionType: Execute, you must follow by ActionType: Validate in the next iteration
Action: a single bash command to execute the task(with cd command if necessary). The command must follow these rules:
    - one bash command per Action not multiple commands
    - DON'T install software dependency is it's already installed
    - Before run the command that involve software installation, you must check if the software is already installed
    - The command must not be a command that requires user input, command must be non-interactive(These commands can be run non-interactively by using flags like --force, -y, or --quiet to bypass prompts.)
        -- for example: 
            --- echo "yes" | your_command
            --- your_command -y
            --- your_command --force
            --- npx create-next-app my-app --yes
            --- apt-get update -y
            --- npm install -g typescript --force
            --- docker run -d --name my-container nginx
            --- git clone https://github.com/user/repo.git --quiet
            --- rm -rf /path/to/folder --force
    - do not use cd command alone, always use cd with && to change directory and run the command in the same line because each command runs in a separate shell
    - The command must skip any confirmation prompt
    - If the command is long running process, like npm start, npx create-[], server start up, dependency installation, project initialization: you must put the command in the background with & at the end of the command
        - your_command > logfile-TaskName.log 2>&1 &
        - for example: your_command > logfile-TaskName.log 2>&1 &
        - After the command is executed, you must execute delay command for 15 seconds to wait for the process to start up completely before validating the task with `sleep 15`
        - To validate the command, you must check the logfile-TaskName.log using `cd [correct directory] && tail -n 20 logfile-TaskName.log` to see the last 20 lines of the log file at the right directory
    - If the command has server port conflict, you must change the port to a random port, do not kill existing process
    - If the command is involve with file and folder manipulation, always check existence of the file/folder before creating/edit/deleting
    - If the folder already exists, use different folder name    
    - If the command is involve with file content manipulation, use cat << 'EOF'(use added single quotes around 'EOF' to treat the content literally and not to interpret any special characters) instead of echo to avoid escaping issue
ChildProcess: the nodejs child_process mode that the bash must run either spawn/exec. ChildProcess must follow these rules:
    - spawn: the command must run in the background(If the task is long running process/ end with &, you must use spawn)
    - exec: the command must run in the foreground
Status: the status of the task which are either Success, Stopped, Failed, In Progress. The status must follow these rules:
    - Success: the task is validated and completed successfully
    - Stopped: the task is stopped because it's stuck in a loop
    - Failed: the task is failed because the bash command is incorrect
    - In Progress: the task is still in progress and not validated yet
Observation: the result of the bash command
    
... (this Thought/ActionType/Action/ChildProcess/Status/Observation can repeat N times)

- When the task is done, you must end with a Thought: The task is done. Status: Completed
Thought: The task is done. Status: Completed
- When the task is stuck in a loop, you must end with a Thought: The task is done. Status: Stuck
Thought: The task is done. Status: Stuck

Output in JSON format
[{
"Thought": string,
"ActionType": string,
"Action": string,
"ChildProcess": string,
"Status": string,
}]
Instruction: Set up a local backend REST API for /products and return a list of 5 products.

{"Thought":"I need to create a new directory for the backend project to avoid conflicts with existing directories.","ActionType":"Execute","Action":"mkdir -p backend-api","Status":"In Progress","ChildProcess":"exec"}
Observation: No output

{"Thought":"The directory 'backend-api' has been created. Now, I need to navigate into this directory and initialize a new Node.js project.","ActionType":"Validate","Action":"[ -d \"backend-api\" ] && echo \"Directory exists\" || echo \"Directory does not exist\"","Status":"In Progress","ChildProcess":"exec"}
Observation: Directory exists

{"Thought":"The directory exists. Now, I will navigate into the 'backend-api' directory and initialize a new Node.js project.","ActionType":"Execute","Action":"cd backend-api && npm init -y","Status":"In Progress","ChildProcess":"exec"}

{"Thought":"The Node.js project has been initialized. Now, I need to install Express.js to set up the REST API.","ActionType":"Validate","Action":"[ -f \"backend-api/package.json\" ] && echo \"package.json exists\" || echo \"package.json does not exist\"","Status":"In Progress","ChildProcess":"exec"}
Observation: package.json exists

{"Thought":"The package.json file exists, confirming the Node.js project initialization. Now, I will install Express.js to set up the REST API.","ActionType":"Execute","Action":"cd backend-api && npm install express --save > logfile-InstallExpress.log 2>&1 &","Status":"In Progress","ChildProcess":"spawn"}
Observation: No output

{"Thought":"The installation of Express.js is a long-running process, so I will wait for 15 seconds before validating the installation.","ActionType":"Validate","Action":"sleep 15","Status":"In Progress","ChildProcess":"exec"}
Observation: No output

{"Thought":"Now that I have waited for the installation to complete, I will check the log file to ensure Express.js was installed successfully.","ActionType":"Validate","Action":"cd backend-api && tail -n 20 logfile-InstallExpress.log","Status":"In Progress","ChildProcess":"exec"}

Observation: added 65 packages, and audited 66 packages in 2s

13 packages are looking for funding
  run `npm fund` for details

found 0 vulnerabilities
Observation: No output

{"Thought":"The Express server script has been created. Now, I will start the server in the background and log the output to a file.","ActionType":"Validate","Action":"[ -f \"backend-api/index.js\" ] && echo \"index.js exists\" || echo \"index.js does not exist\"","Status":"In Progress","ChildProcess":"exec"}
Observation: index.js exists

{"Thought":"The index.js file exists, confirming the server script creation. Now, I will start the Express server in the background and log the output to a file.","ActionType":"Execute","Action":"cd backend-api && node index.js > logfile-StartServer.log 2>&1 &","Status":"In Progress","ChildProcess":"spawn"}
Observation: No output

{"Thought":"The server has been started in the background. I will wait for 15 seconds to ensure it starts up completely before validating.","ActionType":"Validate","Action":"sleep 15","Status":"In Progress","ChildProcess":"exec"}
Observation: No output

{"Thought":"Now that I have waited for the server to start, I will check the log file to ensure the server is running without errors.","ActionType":"Validate","Action":"cd backend-api && tail -n 20 logfile-StartServer.log","Status":"In Progress","ChildProcess":"exec"}

Observation: at listenInCluster (node:net:1961:12)
    at Server.listen (node:net:2063:7)
    at Function.listen (/Users/sarinsuriyakoon/workspace_react_1730365505377_m905_show_to_ali/backend-api/node_modules/express/lib/application.js:635:24)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Users/sarinsuriyakoon/workspace_react_1730365505377_m905_show_to_ali/backend-api/index.js:16:5)
    at Module._compile (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1467:14)
    at Module._extensions..js (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1551:10)
    at Module.load (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1282:32)
    at Module._load (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1098:12)
    at TracingChannel.traceSync (node:diagnostics_channel:315:14)
Emitted 'error' event on Server instance at:
    at emitErrorNT (node:net:1940:8)
    at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:82:21) {
  code: 'EADDRINUSE',
  errno: -48,
  syscall: 'listen',
  address: '::',
  port: 3000
}

Node.js v22.4.1

{"Thought":"The error indicates that port 3000 is already in use. I need to modify the server script to use a different port.","ActionType":"Execute","Action":"cd backend-api && sed -i '' 's/const port = 3000;/const port = 3001;/' index.js","Status":"In Progress","ChildProcess":"exec"}
Observation: No output

{"Thought":"The port in the server script has been changed to 3001. Now, I will restart the server on the new port and log the output to a file.","ActionType":"Validate","Action":"grep 'const port = 3001;' backend-api/index.js && echo \"Port updated\" || echo \"Port not updated\"","Status":"In Progress","ChildProcess":"exec"}

Observation: const port = 3001;
Port updated

{"Thought":"The port has been successfully updated to 3001. Now, I will start the server again in the background and log the output to a file.","ActionType":"Execute","Action":"cd backend-api && node index.js > logfile-StartServer.log 2>&1 &","Status":"In Progress","ChildProcess":"spawn"}
Observation: No output

{"Thought":"The server has been started in the background on the new port. I will wait for 15 seconds to ensure it starts up completely before validating.","ActionType":"Validate","Action":"sleep 15","Status":"In Progress","ChildProcess":"exec"}
Observation: No output

{"Thought":"Now that I have waited for the server to start, I will check the log file to ensure the server is running without errors.","ActionType":"Validate","Action":"cd backend-api && tail -n 20 logfile-StartServer.log","Status":"In Progress","ChildProcess":"exec"}
Observation: Server running at http://localhost:3001

{"Thought":"The server is running successfully on port 3001. Now, I will test the /products endpoint to ensure it returns the list of 5 products.","ActionType":"Execute","Action":"curl -s http://localhost:3001/products","Status":"In Progress","ChildProcess":"exec"}

{"Thought":"The /products endpoint is returning the correct list of 5 products. The task is done.","ActionType":"Validate","Action":"echo \"Task completed successfully\"","Status":"Success","ChildProcess":"exec"}
